Check out the Reddit post here: https://www.reddit.com/r/LinusTechTips/comments/1nfwpnv/i_have_a_linus_tech_screwdriver_and_now_i_have_a/

Linus and Luke react to a community member who custom-built a massive 3D printer and created a life-sized Linus screwdriver replica. At 2 meters tall, weighing in at 5 kilograms, and taking 20 hours to print, it’s equal parts impressive and absurd.

Watch the full WAN Show: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=AKmYYnMdW7E

title: The Linus-sized Screwdriver

author: LMG Clips
description:
Check out Zephkek's deep-dive here: https://github.com/Zephkek/Asus-ROG-Aml-Deep-Dive

Thanks to our LMG clips sponsors dbrand, Dell, and Secretlab. You can check them out at the links below:

dbrand: https://dbrand.com/pcb
Dell: https://lmg.gg/dellprowanclips
Secretlab: https://lmg.gg/secretlablmgclips

Linus and Luke discuss a new investigation by Zephkek that reveals ASUS gaming laptops have been plagued by performance issues since 2021, impacting Strix, SCAR, and Zephyrus models. Stuttering, freezing, and audio glitches all trace back to flawed ACPI firmware, and users say the problem persists across both Windows and Linux.

Watch the full WAN Show: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=AKmYYnMdW7E

title: ASUS Laptops Are Broken

Casio is bringing its furry “Moflin” robot to the US for $429. Linus and Luke break down the marketing claims, AI-powered emotions, companionship, and “support you can feel," and question whether gadgets like this are harmless fun or an unsettling step too far.

Watch the full WAN Show: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=AKmYYnMdW7E
